Place was packed when I showed up. Which made me excited for my lunch. Unfortunatly very bland. Your gonna need seasoning. And their chocolate chimis are just deep fryed chocolate chips wrapped and fryed. Way to much chocolate. Chocolate chips were not even melted. Apple chimis filling is from a can u can taste it.  Place is ok but definitely no need for me to go back. Too many good Mexican places around.

Carolina's is our go to spot when we want good Mexican food. They always have friendly people that greet you and take your order. The menu has a lot of options or you can go a la carte. We typically stick with the combos. You tend to get good portions and good deal. And they do catering which is nice if you have want to have a celebration. The only downside is there have been a few mistakes made on orders over the years. But the staff is quick to remedy the problem and in some cases have even given up free food. So far, I have not found another place that compares.

First and last time here. Ordered tamales red chile and beef or should I say a speck of chile and a nickle size amount of beef a dozen for $28.81 yes... that was disgustingly expensive. This place is not mexican and it is over priced  and flavorless, I'm  certain it is frozen microwaved food and the staff is very unfriendly and rude the place is dirty. Don't risk it if you love Mexican food it's not worth it a total embarrassment to Mexican food. Wish I can give them a speck of a star like they did to the beef.

First off the food is not that great. The staff working there is what really sets them to the lowest you can be. At work we often do a group order for lunch or dinner here and tonight they messed up giving us the incorrect item. I called to explain this as I couldn't eat what was given to me. The girl proceeded to tell me I have to bring it back or they won't do anything for me. They close in 10 minutes and I'm at work. I don't have time to drive there within 10 minutes let alone leave work again. She then proceeds to tell me that I got what was on the order and she's not going to do anything for me, in a rude, snobby attitude. I'm pretty mad at this point because what I got was not what I ordered. I ask for a Manager and I'm told there isn't one available. The girls name was Cavina Munoz that I spoke to. I will be down there tomorrow with the day old food that wasn't eaten. Hopefully the Management is better then the employees. Don't go here if you expect good service.
One of the best Mexican food restaurants in Phoenix. Carolinas is great for breakfast and lunch. If you want to splurge get some hand made tortillas to take home. #3 is a favorite pf mine. Enjoy!

This place was good, but not as great as others are making it out to be... I've had better in the West Valley, East Valley, and down south in Tucson. It wasn't very busy when we went, I mean we got our food pretty quick despite the amount of people and a rather large family that was there too.  The food was under seasoned, and the drink and condiment station was a huge mess. I ordered enchiladas as I opted out of the tamales, originally we had wanted to order the Menudo, but they only served it in the mornings of Saturday (we were here on Saturday night) so... hm. Not a fan.

The carne asada tacos were amazing. I didn't take a close look at what they were filled with but it was much more than the regular cilantro and onions... a much enjoyed surprise. The menudo (I ordered red) was pretty good but it could have had more red chile but good nonetheless.  The chimichanga was Very good... Next time I'll order it with a sauce but good even without it.

The food here is good. Nothing amazing and the portions on things like the Chorizo burrito can leave you wondering if there is a tasty meat shortage you are unaware of...But the tortillas are damn good. The Enchiladas are my usual go to here and the salsa is pretty good.   All n' all I am glad it's in the neighborhood but it's not one of those amazing spots you must try. Plus them being closed on Sundays often makes them a miss for me overall.
Killer Mexican food. Always good and definitely not overly greasy. They make their own tortillas. The red choke burrito enchilada style is my favorite.

This is my favorite Mexican food place.  They serve you fast.  I highly recommend the #15 special.  Ask for some spices on the side.  And don't forget to get a drink on the side because the have Mexican drink machine so if you're feeling adventurous you can get flavored horchatas and juices with free refills.  It sounds like I work there but it's just Cuz I eat there so often.  I absolutely love Carolinas!

Do all the cool kids hang out here? Yea they do!   Once again Carolina's has won my heart with her fantastic tortilla's, once you have one you will be disappointed with any other! Both locations I have visited offer stellar tortillas! Thanks for being consistent!   I had my usual Machaca (shredded beef with onions, chilies & spices) Burrito with Papas (potatoes) :P You gotta try one the beef is tender and juicy but not sloppy wet. It is seasoned to perfection with just a mild heat. The potatoes just add another dimension of deliciousness!  My friend had the chicken burrito I tried it but did care for it. The chicken is a mix of white and dark meat and it was on the dry side. She put a ton of hot sauce on it. Also she said she thought it may be better mixed with beans and cheese.   I will see you soon Carolina!

Good food. Piss poor service. Good aweful takeout.  If you want a place to come in, get good food and sit and eat for a few, then this is fantastic. It's a great place to get something you crave and it'll hit the spot.   Don't ever order an anything to go, and not check your food. The people putting things together couldn't care less what's been ordered. Every takeout order is wrong, every time.  Nothing worse than driving to get food you crave, seeing it looks f*ing delicious, and then finding the one damn thing you don't want in your burrito.   Who the fuck puts tomatoes in everything... and why?  They're mushy and cold. They don't belong in my kick ass taco or burrito. Especially when I said "Don't Put Tomatoes In".  That said, they're good.  Don't knock it till' you try it.

Carolina's West is not only friendly, but their food is incredible! My usual is the red and bean burrito, enchilada style. Their red chili is rich with chunks of beef, combine that with their delicious beans wrapped in a tortilla that's large enough to be a baby blanket topped with enchilada sauce, cheese and scallions, and you have a meal that good enough to slap your nana over! Carolina's West, a happy, family environment that once you experience it, you'll keep coming back over and over again. Tell Gina and Anna that I sent you.

I've definitely had better.  The food was good, but nothing I'd go back for.  I enjoyed the food at the little hole-in-the-wall across the street (Taqueria Los Angeles)  far more.  There was no comparison.    I ordered a couple machaca soft tacos and a chimichanga.  They were busy, but not overwhelmed.  It took 25 minutes to get my food.  People were getting a bit testy and a couple made a scene about the slow service.   I think the tortillas would have been good, but the tacos were so wet, I couldn't pick them up without them falling apart.  The machaca was bland until I doused them with salsa... that I had to ask for.     The chimichanga was good... loaded with the machaca beef.  It was still a bit bland though, but salsa helped.  I don't know if I'll go back.

once fazoli's, now turned into mexican restaurant..  i wanted to try the place... but mexican food is so common around here.. so it is nothing special to me.. besides.. they taste pretty much the same.. right? well.. no..  i walked in.. long line of people waiting to order..  i stared at the menu.. and so much to choose from..  everything sounded so good..    i ended up ordering enchilada combo plate..  did i mention they have different selection of fountain drinks with mexican juices? everything about the place felt pretty authentic..  they make their own tortillas, chips, and everything else they serve.. you can taste the difference..  saw lot of hispanic people eating.. which shows their food is traditional and authentic.     only thing i don't like..  they close at 8:30pm and closed on sundays.. bummer..

I was kinda disappointed.  Came to have dinner on a Friday night and they had no chips. Food came out quick and was cold. The staff seemed more worried about going home then good customer service. Food was bland and I will not be back to this place. Not to mention they were closing down the dining area at 8pm. So while we ate our cold food we had to listen to chairs being moved around, trash cans being cleaned and covered 8 feet away from us and how can I forget the Mexican lady in the kitchen screaming and yelling something.  I don't speak Spanish so I couldnt help her with whatever she was squawking about. Sad

Delicious!  I have never been to the Carolina's downtown, so this was my first experience with the place. I had some friends raving about their tortillas and talking about how they are the only ones they will use anymore, so of course my interest was peaked.  This combined with all the rave reviews and me and the husband decided to take the short trip this past Wednesday.  The locations was clean, and the employees were polite. The menu is extensive so I caved and went with the number 9 since it had rave reviews in a previous review. The beans and rice were very tasty and the tacos tasted better than any other "taco stand" joint I have been to and best of all were not loaded with grease. The tortillas used in the tacos were thin and crunchy and boy did the NOT skip on the cheese. The husband ordered a chimichunga and he was pleased to find out  that it was only chicken inside (he has texture issues with onions and chilis) and he was over the moon with the "non chunky" salsa with a good kick to it. We tried a cheese tortilla (once again not super greasy at all) and a buttered tortilla. Next time we would do either a cheese tortilla or the chips, not both. We really did end up over ordering but for under $20 and lunch for the hubs the next day we really couldn't complain.  We will be back, soon I hope. This is definitely on the guilty pleasure list.
Great authentic food havent had good mexican food like this in a very long time, great flavor, had the taquitos and loved everything about the food  A+

If you need a fast lunch this place is OK however the tacos are pretty bland and the cheese might as well be Kraft. For $2.25 a taco I expect something far better then shredded iceberg lettuce, chicken and Kraft. But this area doesn't have many options so it could be worse. It won't kill you, but the tacos are nothing to write home about.   The actual tortillas are good but what's in the middle isn't that great...

My family ordered a green chili burro meal and a carme asada burro and I wasn't overly impressed. The food was average but under seasoned, especially salt. The green chili wasn't too spicy and needed more acidity because I didn't taste any lime either. I probably wouldn't go back here but my mom enjoys their food so we may try it again just in case it was just a bad day.

The lines alone should show you how amazing the food is at this restaurant! My family loves to eat here. The food comes out and is served in a styrofoam containers which is a let down but do not let that fool you, because the taste is spicy! They have amazing different salsas to taste as well. Do not pass up on desert either, they have the best!

Dicey to review a mexican food stop in Phoenix.  It's like trying to determine the best painting by Andy Warhol - subjective all the way and chances are you will find plenty of people who think his work is crap.  Authentic?  who the hell knows?    For me, I found a menu item I love and can eat it all day long here.  Have tried to recreate the taste at other establishments and haven't for twice the price or more.    So, Carolina's serves a purpose for me.  An infrequent indulgence of my favorite burrito and consistently prepared.  Peace

My first visit and I've not tasted it yet however, my order was wrong from the start. We specifically stated plain no cheese or lettuce or anything just flautas. Our order came up and they were covered in cheese and guacamole.  They forgot our chips so we had to do another separate transaction.  I hope the food is good because I'm already over it.

First I want to say, I absolutely LOVE your food!!! It's amazing and the staff is phenomenal! Carolinas is my go to place every time I'm craving Mexican food because you guys know exactly how to do it! The one and only reason I am giving 4 stars is because of this one incident today. The first time I've ever had even the slightest issue. I bit into my delicious amazing burrito and was stabbed in the mouth by something that I've discovered is one of those goat head thorns that grow outside. I don't want to jump to conclusions, I'm just not exactly sure how one of those things ended up in my burrito and it definitely didn't feel very good stabbing me in the gums. I know this is just a one time mistake and I'm not holding it against you guys, but I definitely think it's something you might want to look into. Maybe just a little clarity on how it ended up in my burrito?

Love this place and couldn't wait for it to open. It was previously a Fazzoli location and the decor didn't change when Carolina's moved in. The menu is awesome. The menu got better. No matter what you order with menu numbers or ala carte, your food comes hot and delicious.  No speedy drive thru, their lobby is so busy  they closed it, to focus on customers face to face It's family owned and a freat place to fill up.

I am so excited to see Carolina's in the West Valley. There are not many places that I can enjoy Mexican food on my side of town and the price is right. You can tell by the long lines that we have been needing it for a while. Get there early on Saturday for Menudo cause they are usually out by 9:30.
I went back last night and I noticed that the menu was adjusted again to include the original combo plates back onto the menu.

I am tempted to give 5 stars because they have good prices. In terms of food I'd say that their tortillas are good it's what makes their burritos worth eating. Their machaca burrito was good, their red chili burrito was good, but I wasn't a fan of the green chili burrito.   I can't recall ever having a green chili burrito that was as gelatinous, it was almost like a gravy which in itself isn't bad - but is when it's more gravy than meat. I'd say it's more of a gravy burrito then green chili burrito. My idea of green chili burrito is one you'd get at St. Mary's tortilla factory in Tucson (which also has way better red chili burritos too lol but I digress).  All I've eaten are the burritos here which I would say overall are good. While their prices are good it's not mega cheap...just cheap..because I eat quite a bit and I need 2 burritos to make a dent while in Tucson I can go to BK's and get full off one and it's about the same price. But still it's priced very reasonably (I lived in california for a bit and I'd say these sized burritos would be like 6 bucks while a burrito like one at BKs might be 9.50)  I shall update when I have the litmus test - carne asada. I don't expect it to be as good as BKs because I don't smell mesquite grilling the meat but maybe they use good spices - keeping an open mind lol.
Very casual and everything is ridiculously cheap and flavorful. Best fast food Mexican bar none. Closed Sundays!
Such good food! Always stop there once or twice when I'm in Phoenix.
Way over rated. Did not enjoy anything about the place. Sloppy presentation and very little food. Never again.
Food taste amazing so you'll have to wait in line. The portion size for the rice and beans was a disappointment. Paid for a adult meal and received a children's portion

I have grow up in Arizona with Mexican food and this place is THE BOMB!!  I am very picky when it comes to my Mexican food (No one can compare to my Nana, God rest her soul)  I am addicted to their hot sauce.  You have to take some tortillas home with you or you will have to drive back just for them.   It is like fast food there, food served in Styrofoam and plastic silverware so if you can get over that you will not be disappointed.

I LOVE this place!!! The food is excellent and the workers are so nice. I always get the same thing, the Oaxaca burrito which is amazing and a taco which is also really good, hence why I get the same thing every time lol. I've also tried the red & green chili which are really good too. I have nothing bad to say about this place just go and try it NOW!
Tamales were good. Prices good. Fast service. I would get the tamales again but without the sauce as it took over the flavor

Mmmm, mmm! That's all I gotta say.  Okay, maybe I have a little more to say, like just try the double-wrapped beef enchiladas (#12), and you may be ruined for anything else on the menu.  While my family prefers the machaca beef burrito, I am hopelessly devoted to order #12.  Devine as well.  It's arguably the best mexican food in Phoenix. Seriously.  I only give it four stars because I haven't tried anything else yet.

This place is gross.... Taco salad came out runny from all the juice from machaca beef. Tasted terrible too. Had to pour out so much liquid got sick looking at it. Bad stomach ache after eating there! Asked for 1 taco salad no shell, and one with shell both came without. Forgot our bag of chips and salsa. Why do we pay for chips and salsa when the salsa is free??? I won't ever go back!!

This restaurant is just as good as it's original location in South Phoenix.  With that said I would rate Carolina's as the best fast food Mexican eatery in the Phoenix metro.  You really can't get any better than this, you can try, but I doubt you will.  The location for the West Valley isn't bad right off of the 101 and Peoria Avenue.  Pretty centrally located considering the area.  The place is always clean, the workers are very friendly and add to a welcoming experience.  You really can't beat the prices for the quality that you're getting.  The place is always busy and I can totally see why.  Serving very tasty food at a low price.  What else can you ask for?

It's always fun coming out to this place because the service is so great. The cashiers are genuinely friendly  and know a lot about their menu.   Let me start off by saying that I love their beans, I love their rice and I guess I just love all of their food. They have a wonderful red sauce and a wonderful green sauce. They run out of green sauce a lot though. Carolinas is always very busy so I recommend you know what you want when you get there. I would love to come here more but it's out of the way. It is however worth the drive. Fully recommend

I had never heard of this place until recently.  I'm a fan of mexican food from around the valley and when offered to try this place I was up for it.  The first time I ate here it was amazing, and everytime after has been better.  In the last month i've probably eaten here about 6 times.  The 1 thing I would like change about this place is they need more variety when it comes to salsa, I personally would like something hotter, but aside from that this is as good as it gets either for a quick fast food mexican type place or a sit down authentic restaurant.

Omg!!!! The food here is delicious the chimichangas (shredded beef) are my favorite and the flautas .. rice and beans are also good guacamole is always fresh. My daughter used to get the chicken burritos up until they changed the chicken recipe now I have to go when she is really craving a chimi because then she won't eat :( but other than that the food is super delicious it's always packed not just at lunch hour so be prepared to wait a while for your food but it's worth it .

This place is ridiculous! Don't be thrown off by the new decor... They make their food just like the original Carolina's. Food is second to none when you compare price to quality. Red chili burro with cheese and double wrapped! Yikes!   If you've never been here then you are in for a treat!

Wow, How does a place go down after so many years of success is beyond me. I always enjoyed their food bu the lst two times was mediocre at best. Today I ordered a Machaca burrito with egg and potato and received the smallest burrito I have ever seen at any place I have had. Huge tortillas but wrapped around potato and a little Machaca and egg is a waste of a large tortilla. I can be fooled once and give them a break as I know how good they can be but fool me twice in a row says I need to find a better place. Sorry

In Phoenix, Mexican fast food is as plentiful as a McDonald's is everywhere else.   Filiberto's and Federico's have always been my favorites in Phoenix but Carolina's blows Filiberto's and Federico's almost out of the water...Almost.   Their slogan is something along the lines of "Best tortillas in town" and they are correct. Growing up my mom would always take trips to Tucson to get the hand-made flower tortillas and I thought those were the best things since Capri-Sun pouches but even Carolina's even gives those a challenge for my favorite tortilla.   The burritos are what you expect, just as they say on the menu, but they taste fresher than other fast Mexican food and their chorizo is some of the best I have had in the valley (Next to my Mom's).  My only complaint is that the horchata and hibiscus tea (Jamaica) is from a generic company and you can tell in the taste.   The inside is also very nice for a fast-food place and is very clean...That's always a major plus. If you think you love Mexican food, you must try this place.

Darn this place--the food is so damn good, I'm going to have to join Jenny Craig!  This location is in a building that used to be Fazoli's. It's really easy to find. Clean inside too.  The service is FAST & friendly. You wait in line for the next available cashier....usually just one person. If it's busy, there are two cashiers (CASH ONLY).  Of course, some patrons must be so impatient that they decide to stand right NEXT to you at the register as you are paying. (HELLO! How about alittle personal space here, lady!)  The line, which was all the way to the door  (3pm on Saturday) moved very quickly. You wait off to the side with the other customers until they call your number.  The portions are plentiful and prices are cheap!   Next to the soda station, you'll find plastic wrapped forks, spoons, and knives...and their AWESOME hot sauce. You pump the hot sauce into small 1oz containers...mmmm! This stuff is so addicting--you'll want to eat a handful of Altoid mints or you'll have Mexican food breath all day.  Be sure to order some of their flour tortillas! Man, these things are like the size of an automobile tire! HUGE...and delicious!  I think I've just talked myself into going there AGAIN today!

This taco shop has to be one of my favorites. I can spend a five to six dollars and be too full. This is their third location and I think looks the best interior design wise. I think all of their items are excellent and very reasonably priced. No alcohol, no servers and nothing gourmet but is a great place.
Service is great. Food is delicious , cheap and filling. What else can I say...

Their homemade burrito shells set them apart. The food is better than average for a fast food place. This place is usually busy anytime. There will be times when the order is wrong, Eg like you pay to add cheese and beans to your carniasada burrito and there is one missing. At that that point- dealing with customer service sucks. You may be argued with. If you have to drive back that really sucks they will in no way act like they care or that your time is valuable. But the food is delicious, you will like it. There's an opportunity for better customer service!
Great tortillas and food at a good price.

Just had lunch here and while the wait was a bit longer than I would have liked, the amount of food for the price is the real value.  I ordered one of the combos and I didn't come anywhere near being able to finish it.  In the future I would skip the tostada as it was bland at best, but the taco and cheese enchilada were wonderful.

The tortillas here are very good and he green chili is decent. My order was to go and when they called my number I noticed there were some items missing. The obvious ones were chips and salsa and two burritos. I informed the employee that I didn't get my chips and salsa and I was missing two burritos. The response I got was "you didn't get those already?" I showed the employee my receipt and shortly after received my food. Not having the best confidence in them I checked the containers and saw I didn't receive my fluatas, but instead got beans and chili. I was glad I checked before I left. I have been here a few other times there didn't have any other issues thus I decided in three star rating.

Five stars because I just had the best tacos (of this type) in my entire life at this place!  Yes, this is a fast food environment, yes they serve the food on paper plates, yes you bus your own table etc. etc. Who cares? Does everything have to be Durant's? The fact is, they do Mexican basics better than just about anyone.   I had shredded beef tacos and a single chicken soft taco. Both were the best in their class I have had in my life--including those I've had on trips to Mexico. The hard shell is done in a similar style to what you would find at Filiberto's The soft taco, well, is was a soft taco, but made with Carolina's famous tortillas. Both were a perfect combination of spice, meat, and cheese, with the usual lettuce thrown on as an after thought. The salsa you get out of the little pumps by the soda fountain was also very good.   Housed in an old Fazoli's or Pizza Hut or something, the atmosphere and appearance is similar to one of the newer Filiberto's, but the food sets it apart from the rest.   Oh, and it is cheap.   Love it!

Carolina's dining area has always been just one step below nasty with delays in cleaning tables and over flowing trash bins.  One tended to overlook hygiene given the former "home-made" aspect of their menu.  That has changed over the years, the popularity of the franchise now driving mass-produced Mexican fare that's maybe a notch higher than Taco Bell.  So I was always willing to kick in an extra three bucks or so more than fast food Mexican.  Alas, they have now changed the menu to ala carte and think themselves clever that the customer does not notice their jacked up prices.  I can dine at any number of good sit down Mexican restaurants in my area for about the same price....and without the long waits and having to bus my own table.  Bye Carolina's!  Like that Greek fella that flew too close to the sun with his wax wings, your arrogance and menu pricing manipulations will someday do you in.  Name me another Mexican restaurant that abandoned their combo offerings and I'll name you a business that went under.  Bye!

Let's deal with the elephant in the room first...this place is totally in an old Fazoli's.  Not that there's anything wrong with that, but it's the same weirdness as the generic Mexican joint housed in what was clearly a Pizza Hut once upon a time.  Onto the food.  I had heard all sorts of amazing things about the other Carolina's, so maybe I was setting the bar too high, but I wasn't super impressed.  To me it's just average Mexican food, nothing spectacular and maybe even a bit too greasy.  Also, I know this is more of a fast food location and less of a restaurant, but it just seems odd to go to a Mexican food eatery that does not give you chips and salsa at the table.  Like an Italian place with no bread.  (Did Fazoli's serve bread?)  My biggest beef with this place is the food containers.  Styrofoam city!  It's like McDonald's in the '80s over there.  We've always eaten there yet they always box the food up like it's to-go.  Piles and piles of cups and containers fill the garbage cans, which are probably emptied a staggering amount of times per day.  Yuck.  Overall, I'm giving this place an "eh" three stars.  Not really worth it for me to drive through the goofy, wiggly part of downtown Peoria to get to.

Decided to come down here for lunch one day.  It literally shares a parking lot to my office.    The place was really retro, it was kinda dirty, and the service was a little slow.  I had to wait like 21 minutes and 12 seconds for my food to be ready, and all I ordered was a pair of chicken soft tacos.  The food was okay at best, I got more lettuce than chicken, and the salsa was not hot at all.  It didn't have no kick or anything to it.  The cashier Samantha was very friendly and polite.   The place uses styrofoam boxes and stuff even when dining in, which I found not very unfriendly for the environment, and I personally think the price is a little high.  Overall a good experience, nothing really good or bad about this place.  I might come back someday, maybe.

This is definetly in an old Fazoli's, I know because I help open it when it was built.  Food here is hit or miss, the green chile chicken burrito is blah. Dry and tasteless.  However, the hard shell chicken taco is very good. The cheese enchiladas are good but not great. I have had the chorizo and potato burrito and it is good,  but Ramiro's and Senor Taco do it better.   This was my second visit, first time i could not rate them because they did not have green salsa. This time they did and I give that 4 stars. But, they guy behind the counter acted like they are doing us all some kind of favor by selling it "Oh, your lucky today, we have green salsa". I guess they run out-proof was my first visit- but while it is good, I am not dying to put it on everything, so it is not that good. El Paisano in El Mirage is a carneceria that has the BOMB green salsa.   Why three stars-no carnitas or asada and the tortillas, well the are good but I don't crave them.  I may be a guera ( I am the gringa that speaks spanish and busts all the cabrons talking shit) but let me tell you, I grew up in a Mexican family in Hatch, NM/Las Cruces/El Paso area and have had some spectacular tortillas and these don't even come close.

Got 3 mini beef chimis with rice & beans (no guac or garnish, sour cream on the side). They updated their menu since I last visited and the combo wasn't listed but is still available. It was 30 minutes before closing but the workers were nice enough to make some fresh iced tea for us. My beef chimis were smaller than my friend's chicken chimis, but they were delicious. Love Carolina's mini chimis!
Love their prices & casual atmosphere. Great value & good food !

While the food is excellent and we won't stop getting it I can only give 1 star for a pretty petty policy they have.  While ordering 3 quarts of bean, 2 dozen tortillas and 12 tacos it's pretty obvious that I'm not going to eat it there.  When we ask for a container to put some hot sauce in the answer is we can sell you some if you want a larger container.  So off to the salsa station and fill up 10 or 15 of the little salsa cups and try to balance them going out the door.  You would think with an order like that and the amount it cost they would accommodate you with a container of salsa.  I guess when your food is that good and you are packed all the time you don't have to worry about customer service.

This place is a dive. Not to mention bad food. Enchiladas were cold when we finally got our order. The place is dirty beyond what is acceptable. The only upside was that it was cheap. There are so many other good Mexican restaurants... skip this one.
I ordered red chili meat and got red chili sauce with a tiny bit of meat- when I pointed this out to the counter people they just blew it off. Small portions bad service and ok tasting food.

Only ever eaten here twice and the tacos were pretty good but I always pick up a pint of salsa for the family on my way home from work.  GET A PINT OF SALSAAAAAAA!!!! Goes good with chips, Mexican food, even a cold cut sandwich!

Bad experience!!  Love this place but don't plan on ordering ahead.  Placed an order for tortillas and enchiladas two weeks ago and was given a time to pick items up.  Got there to find enchiladas ready but no tortillas.  Was told 15 to 30 minutes.  45 minutes later they were telling people 30 to 60 minutes.   This was on 12/23 and everyone was picking up orders, but to take orders in advance, then not be able to deliver shows poor planning on management's part. I will no longer depend on them for party food.
The lady on the phone said that they don't sell carne asada tacos anymore.

Oh Carolina's, how are you so good? I'm hooked on the chicken, sometimes mix it up with enchiladas. The tortillas are by far my favorite. You MUST get a buttered tortilla, little slice of heaven. I love that they have horchata as a fountain drink and the hot sauce is just the right amount of spicy. It's always crowded, which is fun. Best Mexican on the west side!

Love Carolinas!  Been to the one on Cactus a handful of times and have been incredibly impressed with their beef tacos.  Have been to this one a handful of times and have had pretty good meals.  While not as good as the Cactus location (Still haven't been to the OG one downtown), their beef tacos were still good.  I was telling my wife how good they were and decided to come down here and show her what was up!    We placed our order for a combo #9, 4 shredded beef tacos, and a beef flauta for my son.  Total came out to $18.47.  Swiped my card, signed the receipt, got our salsas, waters etc and sat down.  A few minutes later, the food was ready.  My wife thought the beef tacos were just ok (she prefers other places like Lolitas, Fredericos etc).  Mine were as good as the Peoria location can be (still not as good as Cactus) .  My son ate a little bit of the beef flauta.  Meal completed, left, and everything was good.  Everything sounds great so far, right?  Well, it was....until I looked at my bank statement.  My bank statement showed a pending transaction from Carolinas for $23.47.  I thought it might have been an error, and it was pending for a good 4 days.  Know what though?  It cleared my account!  Someone added on $5.00 to my bill!  That is small enough for a lot of people not to notice, but that is also bullshit and will not fly with me.  I called my bank and they immediately refunded the money into my account.  They told me that if the merchant disputed it, I may see a charge back to my account (Which is what should have happened in the first place...I should have been charged $18.47 for the food I ordered!).    Anyways....I will be leery to come back here.  Ill take the drive to the Cactus location instead.  If there is a slim chance I do come back here to the Peoria one, I will most definitely be paying in CASH!  Watch your receipts at this place if you pay with your card!
Happy sounds around me. Lots of food for the buck. Enough to take home but not going to. I recommend this. Plain floors but great prices. Finished half. Pleased

Seriously, what more do you need to say about Carolina's than fresh flour tortillas.  If you get nothing else from Carolina's get a dozen tortillas to take home and feast on for days.  You'll regret it if you don't.  The rest of the food is pretty standard Mexican eatery fare.

Stopped in for lunch on Saturday just before noon. It was busy as usual but not too bad. I had a green corn tamale and my hubby had a #3 combo that included a taco, tostada and enchilada with rice and beans.   There is limited seating so while I was in line he went and found us a seat. It took quite a while for our food to come out. My tamale was good although there was more masa than meat. It did have good flavor though. Hubby really liked everything except the red sauce on the enchilada. It almost tasted like someone dumped a bunch of red chili in the pot and didn't finish cooking it. I would definitely not order anything with that sauce on it again. The beans and rice were very good.

First time visiting this place and I was not impressed.   It's dirty, a little disorganized (I understand that a restaurant will end up disorganized due to the chaos, but that does not excuse it from being dirty.)  The carne asada burritos were o.k. They don't have guacamole.  Their three way burrito is disgusting. It's meant to have green and red chili with beans, but I bit into the red chili side and didn't get to see if it had any green chili, because I stopped eating it.  Price is decent. Paid 16 dollars for 3 burritos, but for the type of food I got, I wouldn't pay 5 dollars for it. The quality is not great.   I wouldn't recommend it.

I went to this restaurant with my sisters. One of my sisters ordered a tamale, she was not satisfied. It was so small to be a bit pricey. If we would have known how small it would be for it's price we could have just gotten tamales off someone who sells on their own. My other sister was not satisfied that she was unable to get salsa well because she really couldn't tell what type. Wouldn't go here again sorry, a little too pricey for the quality.

Nasty doesn't begin to describe the food.  For a few bucks more, you can go to a real sit down Mexican restaurant.  I would rather go to any 'bertos than Carolina's again.  I literally got sick minutes after leaving.  Place was crowded, and noisy.  Tables were unbussed. Restroom looked like a truck stop.
They recently changed their menu and started a rewards program. Same great food. I generally call my order in to minimize the wait time.

It took a while, but I am finally hooked on this place.  You have to realize, it's not real Mexican food, it's America's greasy version.  I finally figured out what to get to stuff me- the taco, enchilada and tostada combo- with all beans and no rice.  They have excellent refried beans and their greasy tacos really do get you hooked eventually.  I don't think I've ever changed a review from 2 to 5 stars, but I am doing it now!
SO good! Great prices, great portions - my only complaint is that I wish they had better salsa. The chocolate chimis are amazing.

Tried this based on a review by Seftel in the Republic. Really good down-home Mexican food! Hubs had a red Chile burrito, I had green Chile Machaca. Flavor was excellent, meat very lean, tortilla perfect. Green corn tamales also very tasty.

I really wish that they had chosen another location for Carolina's as my office shares the same parking lot and it is way too easy for me to walk across the parking lot and grab some of the best grub around.  Very hard to keep in marathon shape when eating there 4 times a week-I am weak with the discipline.  Their tortillas are the best in town hands down.  I had never tried a buttered or cheese tortilla until a co-worker ordered a few...very addicting.  They only have one salsa which is not fiery but has a kick, and their chicken burritos are just that, chicken and a tortilla.  No Chipotle style faire here. There is ample parking but seating can be a problem for those who don't work next door.  Hit 'em up if in the area!
Awesome food just as the one on cave creek,  can't beat the prices...  excited to find this location closer by..

The best, most authentic Mexican food!  I have eaten at most of the Mexican places in the valley during my life and while there are equals and many wanna be's, Carolina's is one of the greats!! I started at their original location many years ago, went to the east side location when I moved that way, and now I try to get to the west side location 2-3 times a month. As has been said before, the tortillas are fantastic!! The tacos are large, fresh and full of flavor. I get the beef or machaca (you have to ask) tacos and a red chili burrito when I visit. The red chili has the tart, earthy, smokey flavor that authentic chili sauce should have. The re-fried beans are fresh and made with lard the way they should be. Don't let the word lard scare you!! Real re-fried beans are made with it and that is what gives them the creaminess and flavor that all fried beans should have!  The staff has always been friendly, and while I cannot speak for others, there are tons of people working behind the counters and I have never had anything but quick, friendly service. The ordering line ALWAYS stretches to the door (or out the door) and the 'to go' area is ALWAYS packed. That says something about the place's quality.

Such excellent service!  This location is currently training employees and I can honestly say we've received better service from those in training than we have the regular staff. Last night I went in to pick up a to-go order. The guy who helped me took the time to go through my order with me to confirm I had everything I ordered and that it was correct. Such a simple thing to do...but imagine if everyplace did this. It would save so much frustration!  Thank you Carolina's for training your employees right!

If you are starving Carolina's may save your life. Thats about all. I ordered a Taco (shreaded beef) Cheeze enchilada, and a Tamale with rice and beans. The Taco was flavorless in spite of being very greasy, the enchalada was saved from tasteless by a very mild sauce, which also covered the Tamale. Same problem, very little flavor. The rice was gummy and you guessed it  Tasteless. The "hot sauce" was so watered down it tasted bland also. Have then been sued by some 80 year old from Ohio? The Only redeeming item was the refried beans, they actually tasted like Pinto beans with just enough flavoring to be good. Oh, the counter crew didn't give me the Taco I ordered, until I pointed out that it was missing from my Styrofoam box. Not a good day at Carolina's, probably one of many. I just can't recomend this place. Maybe if they just make tortillas they would be Ok.

This place sucks I ordered a chorizo, potato and egg burrito and  it was one o'clock and they would not serve it because they  don't serve eggs after 11, I talked to the manager and said it is just a damned egg scrambled with chorizo, he said sorry we just don't serve eggs, will not be back. VIVA TRUMP And I am Mejicano!

After 4-5 visits since opening May 5th, I'm having trouble wanting to come back.  There are excessive delays in getting your food and a cluster of people standing at the side of the restaurant waiting for their orders too.  It's as if the location size (especially kitchen) can't handle the restaurant volume.  I've figured out that this place is more expensive than I thought because you simply can't fill up on just one item.  It's nice that the burrito is only $3.25 or so, but it's not enough for a hungry adult - add your tostada, chips/salsa, taco, soda pop, etc. and you're easily approaching $10.

I knew this place must be good when I went there for lunch on a Wednesday and the line was out the door at 11:20, so get there early!  I had the beef hard shell tacos and chips and salsa.  Everything was excellent and reasonably priced!  I would highly recommend going here!

Always like coming here. I really like their green burritos. Lots of nice chunks of pork. Their tortillas are some of the best I have had. They could do some up grade to the inside of the store. Not dirty just getting very worn. One drink machine not operating and no ice. This was at dinner time and the store had many customers waiting in line to order. Maybe why they ran out of ice. Every time I come here they are very nice and helpful.

I don't get the obsession with this place. The tortillas are fresh but other than that everything is literally dripping in grease but not much flavor. Service is also slow considering it is set up as fast food. Plus any place that closes on Sunday gets an automatic loss of a star from me.

I heard this was good authentic Mexican food so I thought I would try it.  The menu selection was very limited (good from a business perspective).  I ordered a burrito and rice; the chicken burrito did not have much flavor and the rice was bland.    I will not go back unfortunately.
